CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 9, 1950, pg. 12, reads: "Lovely Brides - The happy sound of 'I do' rang through Pittsburgh during recent days with these charming damsels plighting their troth with the men of their choice...Center photo: Mrs. John F. Bush is the former Mattie Marie King, daughter of Mrs. Halie King of Imperial, Pa., whose marriage was performed at Grace Memorial Church, with the Rev. Harold Tolliver officiating. The bride's brother, Joseph, gave her in marriage.  The groom is the son of Mrs. Margaret Bush of Walkers Mills, Pa.  Attendants were Miss Grace King, Ruth Bush, Genevieve King, Dorothy Drake, Julius King, George Thornhill and Charles King.  James A. Bush was best man. - Harris Photo..."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of wedding party with five men, including groom John F. Bush, and possibly including best man James A. Bush, Julius King, George Thornhill, and Charles King; and five women, including bride Mattie Marie King Bush wearing long satin gown and holding bouquet, and possibly including Grace King, Ruth Bush, Genevieve King, and Dorothy Drake, posed in front of altar decorated with ferns, in Grace Memorial Church
